content.prompt: Which of the following pieces of evidence would help modify an argument in the excerpt about President Jackson’s intentions toward American Indians?

choices.label: Some representatives of Jackson profited by purchasing land from American Indians who were forcibly relocated.
Some of Jackson’s agents encouraged American Indians from Ohio and Florida to leave their homelands as well.
Jackson had led United States armies that conquered American Indian peoples in the Southeast and forced land cessions.
Jackson believed that relocating American Indians was the only action that would enable them to preserve their way of life.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
